🤖 All You Need to Know About MCP (Model Context Protocol)

MCP (Model Context Protocol), developed by Anthropic in Nov 2024, is now getting all the eye-balls by the AI engineering community. So here is a quick summary of all you need to know 👇

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝗠𝗖𝗣❓↳ MCP is an open protocol helping AI easily connect to external data sources, tools, and systems.↳ It solves a key limitation of AI models by allowing real-time, dynamic data access beyond static training datasets.↳ MCP automatically discovers and connects to new data sources without manual setup, making AI integrations fast and scalable.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗠𝗖𝗣 𝗠𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀❓↳ Traditional methods required custom integrations for each external data source or tool, making systems cumbersome and hard to scale.↳ MCP provides a standardized, simpler way to connect AI models with the external world.

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗠𝗖𝗣 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀❓↳ Dynamic discovery: AI models automatically detect and use available MCP connectors without pre-configured setups.↳ Universal compatibility: Works with multiple models, including DeepSeek, Llama, Claude, and all other LLMs/SLMs (It's model agnostic).

𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗠𝗖𝗣 ↳ Simplicity: Reduces complexity by eliminating extensive custom coding.↳ Scalability: Allows quick scaling as new external resources become available.↳ Versatility: Capable of dynamically connecting a broad spectrum of external data sources and services.

𝗔𝗱𝗼𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗙𝘂𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 ↳ Adopted by industry leaders like Block, Replit, Sourcegraph, with a rapidly growing community.↳ Upcoming features: enhanced multi-agent collaboration, IoT integration, personalized AI assistants, remote servers, OAuth support, and improved streaming.

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹-𝗟𝗶𝗳𝗲 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 💙 ↳ Checkout the Multi-agent Autonomous Driving System I have showcase below that utilizes MCP to streamline the end-to-end-workflow

𝗭𝗮𝗽𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗠𝗖𝗣 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 ⚡ ↳ Zapier MCP connects your AI assistant directly to over 7,000 apps and 30,000 actions—without complicated API setups.
↳ Your AI can now handle practical tasks like messaging, scheduling, and data management, turning it into a powerful productivity tool.

👉 Step 1: Generate your MCP endpoint quickly and securely.👉 Step 2: Select actions your AI can perform (e.g., Slack messages, calendar events).👉 Step 3: Connect your AI assistant seamlessly.

It's easy to set up, even with minimal coding experience. Try it out for yourself: https://bit.ly/4hHivnS

𝗣𝗦: 𝗜'𝗹𝗹 𝘀𝗼𝗼𝗻 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗮 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗖𝗣 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗭𝗮𝗽𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗺𝘆 𝗱𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘆 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗼𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗿𝘁—𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗲𝗱 💙

Did OpenAI just kill the careers of designers and illustrators?

I see a lot of these posts with this claim 👆 , so here's my take 👇

OpenAI recently introduced a new image generation model as a part of GPT-4o, combining remarkable capabilities in text and image generation. We have all tried Studio Ghibli styles at this point for our personal images (Huge fan!)

Truth: It will disrupt careers and transform the creative landscape!

However, claiming this advancement "kills" careers misses a crucial point: tools enhance creativity; they rarely replace it outright. 

This new model can create stunning visuals in seconds. It can mimic styles, generate ideas, and produce high-quality work. The speed and efficiency are unmatched. 

This shift has left many designers feeling threatened. Job security is at risk. Many wonder if their skills will still be valued. 

I call it the "Creative Disruption Effect".

This powerful change impacts the art world in five critical ways:
→ Accessibility: Everyone can create art now.→ Quality: AI produces high-quality images fast.→ Variety: Countless styles and options are available.→ Cost: Cheaper alternatives to hiring artists.→ Competition: More creators in the market.

Each of these elements brings challenges.
• Increased accessibility = "Oversaturation"
• Quality without effort = "Devaluation"
• Endless variety = "Confusion"
• Lower costs = "Reduced earnings"
• More competition = "Struggle for visibility"

Here’s how to thrive in this new world:

1/ Embrace technology:↳ Learn to use AI tools to enhance your work ↳ Combine your creativity with AI’s power

2/ Focus on storytelling:↳ Create art with a unique narrative ↳ Connect with your audience on a deeper level

3/ Build a personal brand:↳ Showcase your style and personality↳ Stand out in a crowded market

4/ Collaborate:↳ Work with other artists and tech experts.↳ Create something new and exciting

5/ Keep learning:↳ Stay updated on trends and tools↳ Make YOU + AI your personal brand!

The future belongs not to AI alone, but to those who best leverage the collaboration between "human ingenuity" and "artificial intelligence"

While I enjoy my Studio-Ghibling phase, you can check out my podcast with Thomas Wolf on my YT channel: https://lnkd.in/dnMW26RX

PS: If you are feeling adventurous, you can screenshot your favorite moment from the podcast, "Studio Ghibli" stylize it on ChatGPT-GPT4o and post below with your thoughts 😄

I spent hours trying to get GPT-4o to generate a perfect deepfake of my own face.

And it refused.

That moment reminded me of something important: Responsible AI matters ‼️

Especially as we move toward a future where creating almost anything online is just a few clicks away.

We’re entering a new era—Where the power to build, manipulate, and influence is becoming democratized.

And that raises a big question:

Where do you see the biggest potential (and risks) in the world of AI-generated imagery?

Podcast with Thomas Wolf, co-founder Hugging Face dropping tomorrow morning 8am PT!

All You Need to Learn About AI Agents 🤖

I've recently checked out the comprehensive e-book "Mastering AI Agents" by Pratik Bhavsar at Galileo🔭 , an excellent resource exploring the practical applications and deep technical insights of AI agents powered by Large Language Models (LLMs).

→ 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗔𝗜 𝗔𝗴𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀
AI agents use LLMs to autonomously execute complex tasks, make decisions, and dynamically interact with external tools and data.

→ 𝗗𝗶𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗧𝘆𝗽𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗔𝗜 𝗔𝗴𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀:
↳ Fixed Automation Agents
↳ LLM-Enhanced Agents
↳ ReAct Agents
↳ ReAct + RAG Agents
↳ Tool-Enhanced Agents
↳ Memory-Enhanced Agents

→ 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗙𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
↳ LangGraph
↳ AutoGen
↳ CrewAI

→ 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗲𝘀 & 𝗦𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀
↳ Infinite Loops, Cost, Context Accuracy

I often hear ambitious people say, "I want to be the next Steve Jobs," or "I'm going to be the next Jensen Huang," or even "I aspire to be the next Mark Zuckerberg."

While it's admirable to draw inspiration from great minds, there's a fundamental flaw in this mindset.

None of these groundbreaking leaders became who they are by trying to replicate someone else's path. They became great precisely because they embraced their unique perspectives, leveraged their own superpowers, and built authentic personal brands.

Trying to become the next someone else robs you of your greatest strength: being authentically YOU.

Don't strive to become the next somebody. Commit to becoming the first YOU.

Austin Starks this is an open platform and everyone has the right to post what they like/ what they believe. Name calling/ policing people's post just shows the bitter nature of yours. There is a respectful way to share your thoughts :)

I checked out the blog you shared, and while it shows that v3-0324 performs poorly for "your selected" use-case it DOES NOT take away the fact that it performed exceptionally well on the non-reasoning model benchmarks.

While you are entitled to your opinions, facts speak louder than your opinions!

🚨 BREAKING: Open source AI just hit a major milestone!

And it’s called DeepSeek V3-0324.

For the first time ever— An open weights model is the top-performing non-reasoning model in the world, surpassing even proprietary giants like Gemini 2.0 Pro, GPT 4.5 (preview) and Claude 3.7 Sonnet.

📍 DeepSeek V3-0324 is a huge checkpoint update to their already strong V3 release.

With a 7-point surge in the Artificial Analysis Intelligence Index, it’s now the fastest and best-performing non-reasoning model out there.

Fireworks AI supports DeepSeek v3-0324 deployment. If you are an AI Engineer building applications using LLM, go check it out.

Our co-founder and CEO, Lin Qiao, took the stage at HumanX to deliver a powerful keynote on the future of open-source AI.

She spotlighted DeepSeek R1 and shared why open-source models aren’t just alternatives—they’re the foundation for the next wave of AI innovation.

Curious about the difference between AI automation and AI agents—and how each impacts your business?

AI automation handles repetitive tasks. AI agents are adaptive and autonomous.

Here’s how each impacts:
① Sales: instant lead insights
② Marketing: hyper-personalization
③ RevOps: predictive analytics

“Too talkative.”

That was one of the most common remarks on my school report cards. I was always expressive, curious, and eager.

Instead of channeling it into debate or creative activities, I was told to tone it down.

Later in life, I realized: That trait was my superpower. 💫

Your uniqueness is your edge. Invest in it. Share it. Shine with it.

2025 isn't just about AI agents—it's about the synergy of Human × AI.

At Adobe Summit, I saw:
1️⃣ Agentic AI for strategic execution
2️⃣ Unified AI orchestration via Adobe Experience Platform
3️⃣ Generative AI for video and 3D
4️⃣ Conversational Analytics

Human + AI = Next-level productivity. Let’s build this future together.

Researchers just published "The Moore's Law" of AI usefulness.

AI is doubling the length of tasks it can handle (at 50% accuracy) every 7 months for the last 6 years.

Now? Claude 3.7 handles 1 hour. In 10 years? Weeks.

Wondering how AI Agents work?

Here's the 6-step architecture most use:
1️⃣ Perception (inputs)
2️⃣ Processing (understand context)
3️⃣ Reasoning + Planning
4️⃣ Execution (actions)
5️⃣ Learning (from feedback)
6️⃣ Adaptation (real-time tuning)

What is Data Intelligence and how should you leverage it?

Data Intelligence is redefining how successful organizations make decisions. It goes beyond traditional data analytics by integrating deep insights, context, and actionable intelligence directly into business workflows.

At the core of effective Data Intelligence lies a crucial yet often underutilized element: the Semantic Layer.

Here’s why the semantic layer matters:

✔ Data Accessibility
✔ Open Standards
